page.title: 14MILKING AND CALVING
page.content: Each cow is milked at Copthall Farm twice a day and supposedly should produce 5,000 litres per cow a year. The milking parlour used to be a milking shed but was converted in 1970 to its present use. 6 cows can be milked at one time.When the milk has been collected from the cows into the milk churn, it is put onto a lorry and driven to Daltons Farm and delivered to the homes.Daltons Farm, Copthall Farm and another farm are all connected. The cows calf all year round. They have a nine month gestation period. When the calves are born,they are taken away from their mothers. They drink the milk before it is pasturised although it is unnaturally fed to them by hand. By Claire Hockley,Sarah Bevis and Jo Eldridge.
